Heading: Number of victims
Value: Claims to have killed 20-50 people, but only 13 have been confirmed so far

Heading: States where killing occurred
Value: Idaho, Nevada, California, Arizona, Missouri, Illinois, Kentucky, Texas, Tennessee, New York, Oklahoma

Heading: Type of killer
Value: Confrontational, robbery, pure anger, most sexual assault

Heading: Number of siblings
Value: 6, 2 older brothers, a twin sister, and 3 younger brothers

Heading: Parent’s marital status
Value: Married, but not to the biological father

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: Unknown, however he did drop-out early, indicating that there were problems

Heading: Teased while in school?
Value: Unknown, however he dropped-out, possibly indicating teasing

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: His mother would sometimes beat him (for example when he climbed into the shower with her)

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: While living at his great-aunts house, his mother never visited him.  He had a cold mother that did not seem to care.

Heading: Sexually abused?
Value: Yes, Abused as an 8-year-old child by a man in the neighborhood and by the pedophile raising him for three years.

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: William Sells, an insurance agent, or Joe Lovins, a used-car salesman

Heading: Age of first sexual experience
Value: 8, by a man that was later deemed to be a pedophile

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Barber, mechanic, laborer, truck driver, carnival worker, used car salesman

Heading: Number of children
Value: 2, one of them was given up for adoption

Heading: Diagnosis
Value: Bipolar; depressive disorder; severe opioid, amphetamine, cannabis, and alcohol dependency; and a personality disorder with anti-social, borderline and schizoid features

Heading: Spent time in jail?
Value: Yes, numerous times.  He spent time in jail for a wide range of things including public intoxication, driving without a license, and some drug-related charges.

Heading: Spent time in prison?
Value:
Missouri Department of Corrections 2 year sentence for felony theft. Confined 8 months and released on parole on 
12/18/1985. Returned later, for parole violation 
(DUI). Confined 16 months and discharged.  Wyoming 
Department of Corrections 2 year sentence for felony theft. Confined 16 months and discharged.  Wyoming Department of Corrections on a 2-10 years sentence for malicious 
wounding in 1993.  Released on parole in May 1997.

Heading: Number of victims
Value: Exact number unknown, convicted of 2, probably killed 13+

Heading: Victim type
Value: Women, men, transients, entire families, teenagers, infants

Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Weapon
Value: Guns, knives, bat, shovel, ice pick and his bare hands

Heading: Rape?
Value: Yes, but not with his penis. He is not sexually competent.

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Sentence
